intro: Centropogon latisepalus, commonly known as the broad-sepaled centropogon, is a flowering plant species native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
